dataset.title: Seed collection – dead seeds for evaluation and observation purposes

creator.organizationName: Plant Breeding and Acclimatization Institute (IHAR) - National Research Institute

metadataProvider.organizationName: Plant Breeding and Acclimatization Institute (IHAR) - National Research Institute

abstract.para: The collection includes seeds of weeds collected in agricultural fields, fallows, balks, etc., as well as crop seeds. These seeds were collected by Asst. Kulpa, the founder of this collection and also come from botanical gardens from different parts of the world, e.g. from Brussels (Belgium), Riga (Latvia), Coimbra (Portugal), Jasi and Bucharest (Romania), Strasbourg (France), Dresden, Gatersleben and Leipzig (Germany), Uppsala (Sweden), Vienna (Austria), Basil (Switzerland), Amsterdam (Netherlands), Brno (Czech Republic). Most of the material was received in the 1980's and 1990's.

intellectualRights.para: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution Non Commercial (CC-BY-NC) 4.0 License.

contact.organizationName: Plant Breeding and Acclimatization Institute (IHAR) - National Research Institute

gbif.citation: Dostatny D F (2017). Seed collection – dead seeds for evaluation and observation purposes. Plant Breeding and Acclimatization Institute (IHAR) - National Research Institute. Occurrence dataset https://doi.org/10.15468/8kbpfk accessed via GBIF.org on 2022-02-08.
